data.title: Zuckerberg says Facebook's new approach 'is going to piss off a lot of people'

data.text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Friday said the social media company is going to stand for free speech and encryption.

data.title: CERN drops Facebook's Slack competitor, citing privacy issues and low usage
data.text: CERN, the European Organization for Nuclear Research, on Friday ended its use of Workplace by Facebook, the company's communications tool for companies.

data.title: Facebook refutes Soros claim of a 'special relationship' between Trump and Zuckerberg
data.text: Facebook on Friday issues a statement renouncing recent allegations by liberal financier George Soros that there is a "special relationship" forming between the social media company and President Donald Trump.

data.title: Buy the Post-Earnings Dip in Facebook Stock

data.title: Facebook to remove posts spreading coronavirus conspiracy theories
data.text: Facebook plans to take down posts spreading false claims and conspiracy theories about the deadly coronavirus in an unusually aggressive effort to tackle misinformation.

data.title: Facebook Steering Away From Live Sports
data.text: In a world where the only truly DVR-proof programming remains live sports - and the cost of acquiring the rights for such content remains fairly inelastic, the world’s biggest (and richest) social media network, Facebook, has decided that the cost of competing in this space is “too rich for their.

data.title: As virus spreads, Facebook and Instagram will remove posts with coronavirus misinformation
data.text: Beyond removing coronavirus misinformation, users will also be warned when they try to share posts with misinformation about the virus.

data.title: Facebook joins Google and Twitter in cracking down on fake coronavirus 'cures' and other misinformation
data.text: Facebook says it will start taking down bogus claims about purported "cures" and other unproven theories surrounding the coronavirus, as the deadly outbreak continues to spread globally, sparking a surge in online chatter and misinformation.

data.title: Facebook says it will start removing fake posts and conspiracy theories about coronavirus
data.text: Facebook plans to step up its battle against fake information and conspiracy theories linked to the viral outbreak.
